text: Oh, I’m sorry. Did the middle of my sentence interrupt the beginning of yours?
I’m not arguing, I’m just explaining why I’m right.
I’d agree with you, but then we’d both be wrong.
I’m not lazy, I’m on energy-saving mode.
Don’t worry, I’ve got all the time in the world to listen to your nonsense.
It’s not that you’re ugly; you’re just aesthetically challenged.
Keep rolling your eyes, maybe you’ll find a brain back there.
I’d love to stay and chat, but I’m already late for doing nothing.
You bring everyone so much joy... when you leave the room.
I’m not saying I hate you, but I’d unplug your life support to charge my phone.
Sure, I’ll help you... as soon as pigs fly.
I’m not antisocial. I’m just not user-friendly.
Why yes, I do enjoy being ignored. It’s like a hobby of mine.
Oh, you’ve seen it all? Great, then you’ve seen enough to leave me alone.
I’ll try being nicer if you try being smarter.
Thank you for your opinion! Now run along, adults are talking.
I’m really easy to get along with once you people learn to worship me properly.
I’d give you a nasty look, but you already have one.
Sarcasm: Because beating the crap out of people is illegal.
I’d explain it to you, but I left my crayons at home.
Yes, because walking up stairs totally burns off last night’s pizza.
Please keep talking. I always yawn when I’m interested.
My favorite thing about you? You’re not here.
You sound better with your mouth closed.
Oh, I’m sorry, did I give you the impression that I care?
You’re right, that makes total sense—if we lived in opposite land.
Zombies eat brains. So don’t worry, you’re safe.
I’ll have to pass on your offer—my give-a-damn’s busted.
It’s cute how you think you’re the boss of me.
Keep talking—I’m diagnosing you.
Don’t mind me. I’m just silently judging you.
If I wanted to hear from an idiot, I’d call you.
Aww, your ego is so big. It must be compensating for something.
I would agree with you, but we’d both be wrong.
I’m just surprised you haven’t tripped over your ego yet.
Are you always this stupid, or are you making a special effort today?
I’m impressed by your ability to make me feel smart.
You have the perfect face... for radio.
Sure, let’s do things your way, because you’re obviously a genius.
I never forget a face, but in your case, I’ll make an exception.
Oh, sorry, I didn’t realize you were the expert on everything.
If ignorance is bliss, you must be the happiest person alive.
You must be a magician, because whenever I look at you, everyone else disappears.
Your secrets are safe with me. I wasn’t even listening.
Why don't you slip into something more comfortable—like a coma?
I’d explain it to you, but I’m not sure you’d understand the pictures.
You’re a great friend, but if zombies chase us, I’m tripping you.
Your village called. They want their idiot back.
Oh, I get it now! You’re just really bad at sarcasm.
I could agree with you, but then we’d both be wrong.
Your level of sarcasm is almost as high as your intelligence... oh wait.
I’ve met some pretty stupid people, but you really raise the bar.
Oh, I’m sorry, I didn’t realize I was dealing with a genius here.
You’re special. Just like everyone else.
Your brain’s like a faulty GPS—always leading you in the wrong direction.
Don’t worry, I’ve got your back. From a safe distance, of course.
I’m sorry, I don’t have the patience to pretend I care.
I envy people who haven’t met you.
I’d like to see things from your point of view, but I can’t stick my head that far up my rear.
No, really, keep talking—I always yawn when I’m fascinated.
Your opinion is very important to me. Just kidding.
You should really use that thing between your ears more often.
If laughter is the best medicine, your face must cure everything.
I thought of you today. It reminded me to take out the trash.
I’m not saying you’re stupid, but you’re proof that evolution can go in reverse.
I was going to give you a nasty look, but you already had one.
I’m not saying I hate you, but I hope your Wi-Fi stops working.
You’re like a cloud. When you disappear, it’s a beautiful day.
I didn’t change. I just woke up and realized you’re annoying.
Are you always this annoying, or is it just when I’m around?
You have a face for radio and a voice for silent movies.
If you were anymore in love with yourself, you’d be a mirror.
I see you’ve set aside this special time to humiliate yourself in public.
Do you ever wonder what life would be like if you’d had enough oxygen at birth?
You have something on your chin… no, the third one down.
I’d slap you, but I’m worried it might improve your face.
Do you work at a museum? Because you’re a real piece of work.
You’re not stupid; you’re just... intellectually challenged.
I’m not ignoring you; I’m just giving you time to reflect on your stupidity.
I’m not listening, but please, go on.
I’d agree with you, but I don’t want to lose my status as a sane person.
I would challenge you to a battle of wits, but I see you’re unarmed.
Please go on. I’ve got nothing better to do than listen to nonsense.
If common sense were a superpower, you’d be the sidekick.
I didn’t change—I just learned to stop listening to idiots.
No, you don’t look fat. You just look… well-fed.
I see the wheel is spinning, but the hamster’s dead.
It’s not that I don’t care. Okay, it is that I don’t care.
You’re like a software update. Whenever you show up, I automatically think “not now.”
Your life is so interesting—when you’re not talking about it.
Your future looks about as bright as a black hole.
I’m no proctologist, but I know an asshole when I see one.
You should put that on your resume: “Professional waste of space.”
You’re like a lighthouse in the desert—useless and out of place.
Your aura is so bright! No, wait—that’s just your stupidity shining through.
Oh, you’re talking? Sorry, I stopped caring at “hello.”
Your personality is like a funeral in slow motion.
I would have given you a piece of my mind, but I’m afraid there’s nothing to bounce it off of.
If I had a dollar for every brain you don’t have, I’d have exactly one dollar.
I can explain it to you, but I can’t understand it for you.
